courseDescription:
Are you dissatisfied with the pedagogical pattern of public or private schools? Do you wonder whether your children are learning what they ought to know and when they need to know it? You can opt to teach your child at home, either full- or part-time, using a curriculum best suited to your child’s needs. Homeschooling has become increasingly popular as people from all backgrounds choose to educate their children independently rather than enrol them in traditional schools. It offers a range of benefits as well as challenges for both parents and children. The first step is to determine when and how to start your homeschooling program in terms of the laws that regulate it in your state or country. We explore the world of homeschooling to help you decide if it would be a good fit for your child or ward.

Homeschooling is legal throughout Europe, Australia, New Zealand, North America, Hong Kong and South Africa and is popular in Canada, France, the United Kingdom and the United States. The laws regulating homeschooling are unique to each state so knowing local homeschool laws is of utmost importance. This course will give you an outline of the home education laws in the UK and will guide you with your legal responsibilities. We teach you the numerous benefits and challenges of home education. We discuss the different homeschooling methods, the principle behind each and their benefits and drawbacks. This will help you plan your teaching methodology and select the curriculum and schedule to best fit your child and family. Finally, we will show you the different ways to assess your child’s learning progress that will help them reach their potential, pursue further studies and develop a career.

Homeschooling your children will have an impact on practically every part of your family's life. You will need to consider schooling options, your children’s learning styles, the cost and more. Homeschooling is a one-on-one job where you, as the parent, are the instructor. You will take on the duties and responsibilities of a teacher and administrator. We have designed this course for parents, guardians and anyone who considers homeschooling the best option for their child or ward. There is no prerequisite required and all you need is a passion for teaching. Every parent wants the best for their children. If you contemplate homeschooling, we will help you develop the right mindset and confidence. This course answers many questions on the various learning styles and provides facts about testing and socialization tips. So why wait? Take complete charge of your child or ward's education and register today!
